snippet: Declaring that the issue of human-induced climate change had “moved firmly into the present,” a major study found that water shortages, torrential rains, heat waves and wildfires were worsening.
abstract: National Climate Assessment study reports that effects of human-induced climate change are being felt in every corner of the United States; report is latest in series of dire warnings about how global warming, long foreseen by climate scientists, is already affecting the planet.
lead_paragraph: Declaring that the issue of human-induced climate change had “moved firmly into the present,” a major study found that water shortages, torrential rains, heat waves and wildfires were worsening.

headline.main: U.S. Climate Has Already Changed, Study Finds, Citing Heat and Floods
headline.print_headline: U.S. Climate Has Already Changed, Study Finds, Citing Heat and Floods
